I recently heard that there is a challenge of the state's restriction of polygamy in the courts coming out of Utah. It cites the case in Texas in which the illegality of sodomy was revoked by the courts. You can read about it here (if anyone has more informative links on this then please post them):
 
 http://www.capitaljournal.com/stories/011304/pag_polygamy.shtml 
 
 How will this case affect (for better or for worse) the push for recognition of gay marriage or civil unions?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  polygamy's relation to gay marriage
